intro: Boechera glaucovalvula, commonly known as the blue-veined rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are covered in a waxy, bluish coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. Boechera glaucovalvula is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
